snippet: Large planets with surprisingly sharp orbital angles can exert gravitational forces on other planets, a new study reported.
abstract: Rebekah Dawson study in journal Science explores finding that some large planets in other galaxies orbit their stars very closely, and have unusually elliptical orbits.
lead_paragraph: Large planets with surprisingly sharp orbital angles can exert gravitational forces on other planets, a new study reported.

headline.print_headline: Astronomy: Solar Systems With Their Own Rule Books
headline.main: Solar Systems With Their Own Rule Books
